item.title: Pothole or dip across road, 25th October
item.description:
Where the road goes over the bridge over the A2, on the join, there is a step/dip across whole carriageway. On side going towards Gravel Hill from Bexley village. Noticed today when I drove over it with a loud thud.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car on the curb with broken window, 25th October
item.description:
The car have been parked on the traffic island for a few weeks and all there are is only a PCN issued. The driver side window is down/broken. Broken in vehicles are increased crime risk to the neighbourhood.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 91, Beresford Street, Woolwich, London

item.title: Two heavy metal canisters abandoned on pavement, 25th October
item.description:
On the north side pavement opposite the NE end of Graham Mansions, in the pit of a tree planting, are two heavy metal canisters (laughing gas?) abandoned and uncollected, outside the new shopfront painted white
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Graham Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Tree overgrown and lots of leaves, 25th October
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Holly Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 25th October
item.description:
There have been items left dumped in front of a public pathway. There is mattress strewn across the floor near the parking bays and is very unsafe and could very likely cause accidents the longer it is left there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Dewar Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole / road defect, 25th October
item.description:
There is a dangerously sunken inspection cover outside 444 Brixton Road, SW9 8BH. The surrounding tarmac has collapsed leaving a void that can trap a bicycle wheel. On 25 October 2025 at approx 14:00 my front wheel dropped into this defect and I was thrown off, suffering cuts and bruising. This presents a serious and foreseeable hazard to cyclists and requires urgent repair.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brixton Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
